revised_title: Magnetization and Curie Temperatures of Nickel-Copper Alloys
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on nickel-copper alloys to measure their spontaneous magnetization and Curie temperatures. They found that the magnetic moments per atom of the alloys vary linearly with composition, and the reduced magnetization-temperature curves show a continuous decrease in fullness with increasing copper content. This study provides a more accurate understanding of the magnetic properties of nickel-copper alloys compared to previous research.
